intro: Crambe laevigata, commonly known as the smooth crambe, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a smooth texture, which gives it its common name. Crambe laevigata is often found in moist soils along stream banks and in woodland edges.
